p: During the SARS epidemic in 2003, herbal extracts were used in Asia to treat the disease supplementarily to treatment with western medicine. Among those were also extracts from Rhei radix (rhubarb), and an effective component seemed to be the phytodrug emodin (1,3,8-trihydroxy-6-methylanthracene-9,10-dione), which blocks the Ba 2+-sensitive current mediated by 3a protein, but not the endogenous component (Fig.â€¯ 8.18).
